# UnitDispersion

**Class**

A unit of measure for specific quantities of dispersion.

## Declaration

```swift
class UnitDispersion
```

## Overview

You typically use instances of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitDispersion] to represent specific quantities of dispersion using the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMeasurement] class.

### Dispersion

Dispersion describes the amount of a constituent divided by the amount of all other constituents in a mixture. Dispersion is a dimensionless quantity that is commonly expressed in “parts-per” notation, such as “parts per million” (ppm), to describe small relative quantities.

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitDispersion] class defines its [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Dimension/baseUnit()] as [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitDispersion/partsPerMillion].



## Accessing the Base Unit

- **baseUnit()**: Returns the base unit.

## Accessing Predefined Units

- **partsPerMillion**: The parts per million unit.

## Concentration and Dispersion

- **UnitConcentrationMass**: A unit of measure for concentration of mass.
